home.title: SF Ready Meals
home.description: SFHSA's Congregate Meals Program offers nutritious, low-cost meals to seniors 60+ and adults with disabilities everyday at many community dining sites throughout the city. In response to COVID-19, most sites offer takeout meals.

footer.title: Contact Us
footer.contactPage: Visit the contact page to directly call the location you'd like to reach.

about.title: About SF Ready Meals
about.description: This congregate program serves nutritious meals at community dining centers across the city. Note: Due to COVID, many dining centers may provide take-out meals only, or as an option with limited communal dining. This website is a collaboration of SFHSA, Dev/Mission and Code for San Francisco

sfhsa.title: San Francisco Human Services Agency
sfhsa.description: San Francisco Human Services Agency supports individuals, families, and communities with food, health care, financial, employment, child care, and protective services.

devMission.title: Dev/Mission
devMission.description: Dev/Mission has been connecting more than 260 low-income young adults to careers in Tech through post-secondary STEM careers and jobs in the tech industry as well as exposing K-12 to STEAM Activities. Dev/Mission provides STEM opportunities for untapped 6-24 year-olds San Francisco Bay Area youth. Our goal is to connect underserved populations to careers in technology by teaching programming, hardware, and critical career skills.

c4sf.title: Code for San Francisco
c4sf.description: Code for San Francisco is part of the Code for America Brigade Network. We are a welcoming and inclusive volunteer group of developers, designers, data geeks, and citizen activists who use creative technology to solve civic and social problems.
